content.text: What is the main theme depicted in the paintings of Ajanta Caves?
The main theme depicted in the paintings of Ajanta Caves is the life of Buddha and various Jataka tales.
What is the most prominent feature of the Ellora Caves?
The most prominent feature of the Ellora Caves is the monolithic Kailasa Temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.
What is the architectural style of the buildings inside Agra Fort?
The buildings inside Agra Fort showcase a blend of Islamic, Persian, and Hindu architectural styles.
What is the material used in the construction of the Taj Mahal's dome?
The dome of the Taj Mahal is constructed using white marble adorned with intricate inlay work of precious and semi-precious stones.
What is the significance of the Sun Temple's orientation in Konarak?
The orientation of the Sun Temple in Konarak is designed to align with the east-west path of the sun, symbolizing the passage of time and the cycle of the day.
What is the legend associated with the creation of the Shore Temple in Mahabalipuram?
According to legend, the Shore Temple in Mahabalipuram was created by the Pallava king Narasimhavarman II to commemorate the victory of his naval forces over the Chalukyas.
What is the primary habitat of the one-horned rhinoceros in Kaziranga National Park?
The one-horned rhinoceros in Kaziranga National Park primarily inhabit the tall grasslands and marshes of the park.
What is the most sought-after species for wildlife enthusiasts in Manas Wildlife Sanctuary?
The most sought-after species for wildlife enthusiasts in Manas Wildlife Sanctuary is the Bengal tiger.
What is the unique feature of the wetland ecosystem in Keoladeo National Park?
The unique feature of the wetland ecosystem in Keoladeo National Park is its role as a crucial wintering ground for migratory birds.
What is the architectural style of the churches in the Churches and Convents of Goa?
The churches in the Churches and Convents of Goa exhibit a blend of Portuguese and Indian architectural styles, characterized by whitewashed facades, ornate interiors, and decorative altars.
What is the symbolic significance behind the erotic sculptures of Khajuraho Group of Monuments?
The erotic sculptures of Khajuraho Group of Monuments symbolize the celebration of life, love, and spiritual awakening.
What was the main function of the Virupaksha Temple in the Group of Monuments at Hampi?
The main function of the Virupaksha Temple in the Group of Monuments at Hampi was to serve as a center of pilgrimage and worship dedicated to Lord Shiva.
What was the primary reason for the abandonment of Fatehpur Sikri?
The primary reason for the abandonment of Fatehpur Sikri was the scarcity of water, leading to the relocation of the capital to Agra.
What is the religious significance of the temples in the Group of Monuments at Pattadakal?
The temples in the Group of Monuments at Pattadakal are dedicated to various Hindu gods and goddesses and served as centers of religious and royal patronage during the Chalukyan dynasty.
What is the main deity worshipped in the Elephanta Caves?
The main deity worshipped in the Elephanta Caves is Lord Shiva, particularly in his form as Mahesha, the Lord of the Universe.
What is the historical context behind the construction of the Great Living Chola Temples?

The Great Living Chola Temples were constructed during the Chola dynasty rule in South India, representing the pinnacle of Dravidian temple architecture and the Chola Empire's cultural and religious achievements.
What is the main challenge faced by the inhabitants of Sundarbans National Park due to its geographical location?

The main challenge faced by the inhabitants of Sundarbans National Park due to its geographical location is the constant threat of tiger attacks and natural disasters such as cyclones and tidal surges.
What is the best time of the year to witness the blooming of flowers in Valley of Flowers National Park?
The best time of the year to witness the blooming of flowers in Valley of Flowers National Park is from mid-July to mid-August, during the monsoon season.
What is the architectural style of the stupas in the Buddhist Monuments at Sanchi?

The stupas in the Buddhist Monuments at Sanchi are primarily constructed in the early Buddhist architectural style, characterized by a simple hemispherical dome atop a raised platform, symbolizing the enlightened mind of the Buddha.
What is the historical significance of Humayun's Tomb in Delhi?
Humayun's Tomb in Delhi is historically significant as it is the first garden-tomb on the Indian subcontinent and served as a prototype for later Mughal mausoleums, including the Taj Mahal.
What is the main purpose of the Iron Pillar in the Qutb Minar complex?
The main purpose of the Iron Pillar in the Qutb Minar complex is believed to be a commemorative monument erected by Chandragupta II Vikramaditya to honor his military victories.
What is the highest altitude reached by the Mountain Railways of India?
The highest altitude reached by the Mountain Railways of India is 2,076 meters above sea level at Ghum, West Bengal, making it the highest railway station in India.
What is the significance of the Bodhi Tree in the Mahabodhi Temple Complex?
The Bodhi Tree in the Mahabodhi Temple Complex is believed to be the very spot where Gautama Buddha attained enlightenment, making it one of the most sacred sites in Buddhism.
What is the age of the oldest rock painting found in the Rock Shelters of Bhimbetka?
The age of the oldest rock painting found in the Rock Shelters of Bhimbetka dates back to approximately 30,000 years ago, depicting scenes from prehistoric life.
What is the historical event depicted on the central dome of Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus?

The historical event depicted on the central dome of Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus is the progress of Indian civilization under British colonial rule, symbolized by a figure holding a torch of progress.
What is the significance of the Kalikamata Temple in the Champaner-Pavagadh Archaeological Park?
The Kalikamata Temple in the Champaner-Pavagadh Archaeological Park is dedicated to the goddess Kalika, an incarnation of Goddess Durga, and is believed to fulfill the wishes of devotees.
What was the purpose of the Diwan-i-Khas in the Red Fort Complex?
The purpose of the Diwan-i-Khas in the Red Fort Complex was to serve as the hall of private audience where the Mughal emperor received select guests and held confidential meetings.
What is the main astronomical instrument used in The Jantar Mantar for measuring time?
The main astronomical instrument used in The Jantar Mantar for measuring time is the sundial, known as the Samrat Yantra, which casts a shadow to indicate the time accurately.
What is the main threat to the biodiversity of the Western Ghats?
The main threat to the biodiversity of the Western Ghats is habitat loss and fragmentation due to human activities such as deforestation, urbanization, and agricultural expansion.
What is the main defensive feature shared by all the Hill Forts of Rajasthan?
The main defensive feature shared by all the Hill Forts of Rajasthan is their strategic hilltop location, providing natural protection against enemy invasions.
What is the architectural significance of the stepwell in Rani-ki-Vav?

The architectural significance of the stepwell in Rani-ki-Vav lies in its intricate carvings, which depict various deities, mythological scenes, and Hindu religious motifs, making it a masterpiece of Maru-Gurjara architecture.
What is the main threat to the habitat of the snow leopard in the Great Himalayan National Park?

The main threat to the habitat of the snow leopard in the Great Himalayan National Park is poaching, retaliatory killings by herders, and habitat degradation due to livestock grazing and infrastructure development.
What is the subject of the inscriptions found in the Archaeological Site of Nalanda Mahavihara?

The inscriptions found in the Archaeological Site of Nalanda Mahavihara primarily depict various aspects of Buddhist philosophy, history, and education, providing valuable insights into the intellectual and cultural life of ancient India.
What is the traditional belief associated with the name 'Khangchendzonga'?
The traditional belief associated with the name 'Khangchendzonga' is that it is the abode of the guardian deity of Sikkim, protecting the land and its people.
What is the main feature that distinguishes the architectural work of Le Corbusier?

The main feature that distinguishes the architectural work of Le Corbusier is the use of open floor plans, modular design principles, and reinforced concrete structures, reflecting the principles of modernist architecture.
What is the unique architectural feature of the Pols in the Historic City of Ahmadabad?

The unique architectural feature of the Pols in the Historic City of Ahmadabad is their narrow lanes and intricate wooden facades, reflecting the traditional Gujarati architectural style and providing a sense of community and security.
What is the historical significance of the Victorian Gothic and Art Deco Ensembles of Mumbai?

The Victorian Gothic and Art Deco Ensembles of Mumbai are historically significant as they represent the architectural and urban planning innovations during the British colonial period and the early 20th century, reflecting the city's economic and cultural prosperity.
What is the main festival celebrated within the walled city of Jaipur?

The main festival celebrated within the walled city of Jaipur is the Gangaur festival, dedicated to the goddess Gauri, celebrated with great fervor by womenfolk, showcasing Rajasthan's rich cultural heritage and traditions.
What is the architectural style of the Kakatiya Rudreshwara Temple?

The architectural style of the Kakatiya Rudreshwara Temple is predominantly Kakatiyan, characterized by intricate carvings, detailed sculptures, and the use of locally available red sandstone, showcasing the artistic and engineering prowess of the Kakatiya dynasty.
What was the main source of water supply in Dholavira?
The main source of water supply in Dholavira was an elaborate system of reservoirs and channels.
What is the significance of Santiniketan in Indian cultural history?
Santiniketan is significant in Indian cultural history as the home of Visva-Bharati University, founded by Rabindranath Tagore.
What distinguishes the architectural style of the Hoysala temples?
The architectural style of the Hoysala temples is distinguished by intricate carvings and sculptures, particularly of gods and goddesses.
What is the predominant material used in the construction of the temples at Bishnupur?
The predominant material used in the construction of the temples at Bishnupur is laterite stone.
What are the main themes depicted in the murals of Mattancherry Palace?
The main themes depicted in the murals of Mattancherry Palace include scenes from the Ramayana and Mahabharata.
What is the main architectural feature of the Jahaz Mahal in Mandu?
The main architectural feature of the Jahaz Mahal in Mandu is its boat-like shape, giving it the name 'Ship Palace'.
What event in Buddha's life is associated with the ancient Buddhist site at Sarnath?
The ancient Buddhist site at Sarnath is associated with Buddha's first sermon, known as the 'Turning of the Wheel of Dharma'.
What is the significance of the sarovar (sacred pool) at Sri Harimandir Sahib?
The sarovar at Sri Harimandir Sahib symbolizes spiritual purification and is believed to have healing properties.
What is the main cultural significance of Majuli island?
Majuli island is culturally significant as the hub of Assamese Vaishnavite culture, with numerous satras (monasteries) dedicated to the practice of Sattriya dance and music.
What is the main threat to the biodiversity of Namdapha National Park?
The main threat to the biodiversity of Namdapha National Park is poaching and habitat destruction.
What is the main habitat of the wild ass species in the Little Rann of Kutch?
The main habitat of the wild ass species in the Little Rann of Kutch is the vast saline desert.
What is the main floral diversity found in Neora Valley National Park?
Neora Valley National Park is known for its rich floral diversity, including rhododendrons, orchids, and medicinal plants.
What is the main adaptation of wildlife in Desert National Park to survive extreme temperatures?
The main adaptation of wildlife in Desert National Park is nocturnal activity to avoid extreme daytime temperatures.
What was the main commodity traded along the Silk Road Sites in India?
The main commodity traded along the Silk Road Sites in India was silk, which gave the trade route its name.
What is the significance of the Charminar in the history of Hyderabad?
The Charminar is a symbol of Hyderabad and was built to commemorate the end of a deadly plague epidemic.
What is the primary design element of the Mughal Gardens in Kashmir?
The primary design element of the Mughal Gardens in Kashmir is the use of terraces and water channels.
What are the main architectural influences seen in the heritage buildings of Delhi?
The main architectural influences seen in the heritage buildings of Delhi include Mughal, British, and Persian styles.
What architectural style characterizes the forts of the Deccan Sultanate?
The forts of the Deccan Sultanate are characterized by a blend of Persian, Indian, and Islamic architectural styles.
What was the main purpose of the Cellular Jail during British rule?
The main purpose of the Cellular Jail was to imprison political dissidents and freedom fighters.
What are the main regions known for producing iconic saree weaving in India?
The main regions known for producing iconic saree weaving in India include Banaras, Kanchipuram, and Paithani.
What are the main features of the Apatani cultural landscape?
The main features of the Apatani cultural landscape include the unique practices of terrace farming and nose plugs worn by women.
What is the significance of the Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple in Srirangam?
The Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple in Srirangam is one of the largest functioning Hindu temples in the world and is dedicated to Lord Vishnu.
What is the historical significance of the monuments in Srirangapatna?
The monuments in Srirangapatna are associated with the reign of Tipu Sultan and the battles fought during the British colonial period.
What is the main ecological importance of Chilika Lake?
The main ecological importance of Chilika Lake is as a vital habitat for migratory birds and endangered species such as the Irrawaddy dolphin.
What is the main architectural feature of Padmanabhapuram Palace?
The main architectural feature of Padmanabhapuram Palace is its wooden construction, showcasing traditional Kerala architecture.
What were the main principles of Satyagraha advocated in the freedom movement?
The main principles of Satyagraha advocated in the freedom movement were non-violence, civil disobedience, and truth.
What is the main defensive structure in Thembang Fortified Village?
The main defensive structure in Thembang Fortified Village is its stone walls and watchtowers.
What is the main threat to the unique flora and fauna of Narcondam Island?
The main threat to the unique flora and fauna of Narcondam Island is habitat destruction caused by invasive species.
What is the main significance of the Moidams in Ahom culture?
The main significance of the Moidams in Ahom culture is as burial mounds for Ahom royalty and nobility.
What is the main architectural style of the temples in Ekamra Kshetra?
The main architectural style of the temples in Ekamra Kshetra is Kalinga architecture, characterized by pyramidical towers and intricate carvings.
What is the main archaeological find at the Neolithic Settlement of Burzahom?
The main archaeological find at the Neolithic Settlement of Burzahom is evidence of early agriculture and domestication of animals.
What is the main evidence of Lothal being a Harappan port-town?
The main evidence of Lothal being a Harappan port-town is its dockyard, which was used for maritime trade.
What is the highest railway station reached by the Mountain Railways of India (Extension)?
The highest railway station reached by the Mountain Railways of India (Extension) is Ghum station in West Bengal.
What is the main architectural feature of the mansions in Chettinad?
The main architectural feature of the mansions in Chettinad is their grandeur and elaborate woodwork.
What is the central theme of the Baha'i House of Worship's architectural design?
The central theme of the Baha'i House of Worship's architectural design is unity, with its lotus-shaped structure symbolizing the oneness of humanity.
What are the main architectural elements that evolved in Aihole-Badami-Pattadakal temple complex?
The main architectural elements that evolved in Aihole-Badami-Pattadakal temple complex include the vimana (tower), mandapa (hall), and intricate sculptures.
What is the main cultural practice of the inhabitants of the Cold Desert Cultural Landscape?
The main cultural practice of the inhabitants of the Cold Desert Cultural Landscape is transhumance, where they migrate with their livestock seasonally.
What was the primary purpose of the Grand Trunk Road during ancient times?
The primary purpose of the Grand Trunk Road during ancient times was to facilitate trade and communication between different regions of the Indian subcontinent.
What is the main habitat of the endangered sangai deer in Keibul Lamjao Conservation Area?
The main habitat of the endangered sangai deer in Keibul Lamjao Conservation Area is the floating marshy vegetation known as phumdis.
What is the main biodiversity hotspot found in Garo Hills Conservation Area?
The main biodiversity hotspot found in Garo Hills Conservation Area is Nokrek Biosphere Reserve, known for its rich floral and faunal diversity.
What is the main architectural feature of the Jehangir Mahal in Orchha?
The main architectural feature of the Jehangir Mahal in Orchha is its intricate facade adorned with elaborate carvings and motifs.
What is the cultural significance of the ghats along the River Ganges in Varanasi?
The ghats along the River Ganges in Varanasi hold cultural significance as sites for religious rituals, ceremonies, and cremation.
What is the main deity worshipped in the temples of Kanchipuram?
The main deity worshipped in the temples of Kanchipuram is Lord Shiva, along with various forms of Goddess Parvati.
What are the main types of megalithic structures found in Hire Benakal?
The main types of megalithic structures found in Hire Benakal are dolmens, cists, and menhirs.
What is the geological feature that attracts tourists to Bhedaghat-Lametaghat?
The geological feature that attracts tourists to Bhedaghat-Lametaghat is the marble rocks, carved by the Narmada River, creating stunning landscapes.
What is the main wildlife species targeted for conservation in Satpura Tiger Reserve?
The main wildlife species targeted for conservation in Satpura Tiger Reserve include Bengal tigers, leopards, and Indian gaur.
What are the main defensive features of Maratha military architecture?
The main defensive features of Maratha military architecture include bastions, fortified gateways, and moats.
What are the main subjects depicted in the geoglyphs of the Konkan Region?
The main subjects depicted in the geoglyphs of the Konkan Region are animals, humans, and geometric patterns.
What is the main material used in the construction of the living root bridges?
The main material used in the construction of the living root bridges is the aerial roots of the Indian rubber tree (Ficus elastica).
What is the significance of the monolithic Nandi bull at Lepakshi?
The significance of the monolithic Nandi bull at Lepakshi lies in its association with Lord Shiva and the grandeur of Vijayanagara art.
What is the main feature of the architecture of Sun Temple in Modhera?
The main feature of the architecture of Sun Temple in Modhera is its precision in solar alignment, designed to capture the first rays of the sun during the equinox.
What is the estimated number of rock-cut sculptures present in Unakoti?
The estimated number of rock-cut sculptures present in Unakoti is around one crore (ten million).
What is the main archaeological find that dates Vadnagar as a historic town?
The main archaeological find that dates Vadnagar as a historic town is the discovery of a Buddhist monastery complex, indicating its ancient roots.
What is the primary architectural feature shared by the coastal fortifications along the Konkan Coast?
The primary architectural feature shared by the coastal fortifications along the Konkan Coast is their strategic location overlooking the Arabian Sea.
What is the main architectural feature of the historic ensemble in Dhamnar?
The main architectural feature of the historic ensemble in Dhamnar is its fortified walls and bastions, reflecting its defensive character.
What is the main artistic motif seen in the Gond monuments of Ramnagar?
The main artistic motif seen in the Gond monuments of Ramnagar is the depiction of animals and human figures in vibrant colors.
What is the main feature of the shikhara (spire) of Bhojeshwar Mahadev Temple?
The main feature of the shikhara (spire) of Bhojeshwar Mahadev Temple is its unfinished state, suggesting ambitious architectural plans.
What is the main architectural style of Gwalior Fort?
The main architectural style of Gwalior Fort is a blend of Rajput and Mughal styles, reflecting its rich history of successive rulers.
